original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up on anticipations of a positive Monetary Policy meeting
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade on Wednesday on expectations of a positive Monetary Policy Meeting, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index (ASPI) was up 0.42 percent or 9.95 points to 8,568.58, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.41 percent or 9.95 points to 2,430.68.
“Investors are expecting interest rates to come down and inflation, potentially why the market is seeing a pick up,” an analyst said.
The market generated a revenue of 189 million rupees during 1230 hours.
Top gainers were Lanka IOC, Vallibel One and Ceylon Tobacco Company. (Colombo/May31/2023)
